meanings.definition: To strike with a sharp blow or slap.
meanings.sent1: She whaps the table to get everyone's attention.
meanings.sent2: He whaps the ball with his hand to pass it to his teammate.
meanings.sent3: The chef whaps the dough to make it flat for the pizza.
meanings.sent4: The wind whaps the flag against the pole, making a loud sound.
meanings.sent5: The teacher whaps the ruler on the desk to quiet the class.

meanings.sent1: The whaps on his back left red marks.
meanings.sent2: She felt the whaps on her face after the argument.
meanings.sent3: The whaps from the game show host were all in good fun.
meanings.sent4: The whaps of the waves against the shore were soothing.
meanings.sent5: The whaps of the drumsticks added rhythm to the music.
